module.name: EditBtn
module.short: Implements specialized edit controls with attached speed buttons.

descr.p: editbtn.pas contains specialized edit controls with an attached speed button used to perform an action when it is clicked. The following components are added to the Misc tab in the Lazarus IDE Component Palette:

element.name: NullDate
element.short: Represents a TDateTime type without a value assigned.

element.name: TEbEdit
element.short: Implements the embedded edit control used in TCustomEditButton.

descr.p: TEbEdit is a TGEEdit descendant which implements the embedded edit control used in TCustomEditButton. TEbEdit provides overridden methods to alter the behavior of the control when handling OnEnter and OnExit notifications.

element.name: TEbEdit.DoEnter
element.short: Performs actions needed when the control is entered.

descr.p: Ensures that the button visibility and spacing for the Owner control are handled when the Owner is derived from TCustomEditButton. Calls the inherited method prior to exit.

element.name: TEbEdit.DoExit
element.short: Performs actions needed when the control is exited.

descr.p: Ensures that the button visibility and spacing for the Owner control are handled when the Owner is derived from TCustomEditButton. Calls the inherited method prior to exit.

element.name: TEditSpeedButton
element.short: Implements a speed button used in TCustomEditButton.

descr.p: TEditSpeedButton is a TSpeedButton descendant which provides support for change notifications for Glyphs used on the Button in TCustomEditButton.

element.name: TEditSpeedButton.GlyphChanged
element.short: Performs actions needed when the glyph has changed for the Button in TCustomEditButton.

element.name: TEditSpeedButton.GlyphChanged.Sender
element.short: Object generating the event notification.

element.name: TCustomEditButton
element.short: TCustomEditButton - base class for TEditButton, an Edit Box with attached Speed Button.

descr.p: TCustomEditButton is a TCustomAbstractGroupedEdit descendant which implements a composite control with both an Edit and a Button. It provides overridden methods which extend or re-implement those found in the ancestor class. Most of the properties in the class are declared as protected, and must be exposed as public or published properties in an ancestor class like TEditButton.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.GetFocusOnButtonClick
element.short: Gets the value for the FocusOnButtonClick property.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.GetFocusOnButtonClick.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.GetOnButtonClick
element.short: Gets the value for the OnButtonClick property.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.GetOnButtonClick.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.GetButton
element.short: Gets the value for the Button property.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.GetButton.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.GetGlyph
element.short: Gets the value for the Glyph property.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.GetGlyph.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.GetNumGlyphs
element.short: Gets the value for the NumGlyphs property.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.GetNumGlyphs.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.GetEdit
element.short: Gets the value for the Edit property.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.GetEdit.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.SetFocusOnButtonClick
element.short: Sets the value for the FocusOnButtonClick property.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.SetFocusOnButtonClick.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.SetOnButtonClick
element.short: Sets the value for the OnButtonClick property.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.SetOnButtonClick.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.SetButtonOnlyWhenFocused
element.short: Sets the value for the ButtonOnlyWhenFocused property.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.SetButtonOnlyWhenFocused.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.SetFlat
element.short: Sets the value for the Flat property.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.SetFlat.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.SetGlyph
element.short: Sets the value for the Glyph property.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.SetGlyph.Pic
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.SetNumGlyphs
element.short: Sets the value for the NumGlyphs property.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.SetNumGlyphs.ANumber
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.GetImages
element.short: Gets the value for the Images property.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.GetImages.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.SetImages
element.short: Sets the value for the Images property.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.SetImages.aImages
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.GetImageIndex
element.short: Gets the value for the ImageIndex property.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.GetImageIndex.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.SetImageIndex
element.short: Sets the value for the ImageIndex property.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.SetImageIndex.AImageIndex
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.GetImageWidth
element.short: Gets the value for the ImageWidth property.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.GetImageWidth.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.SetImageWidth
element.short: Sets the value for the ImageWidth property.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.SetImageWidth.aImageWidth
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.ButtonClick
element.short: Performs actions needed when the button for the control is clicked.

descr.p: The implementation for ButtonClick is empty in TCustomEditButton; use a descendent class which implements a specific functionality.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.BuddyClick
element.short: Performs a button click for the associated control.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.GetEditorClassType
element.short: Gets the class type used to create a new edit control instance in the class.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.GetEditorClassType.Result
element.short: Class type for the edit control.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.GetBuddyClassType
element.short: Gets the class type used to create the associated button control for the class.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.GetBuddyClassType.Result
element.short: Class type for the button control.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.GetControlClassDefaultSize
element.short: Gets the default size used for new instances of the class.

descr.p: The return value is a TSize type with the dimensions for the control. The CX member contains the width needed for both the Edit and the Button controls in the grouped edit control. The CY member contains the height used for the Edit and the Button controls.
GetControlClassDefaultSize is called in the constructor for the class instance, and used to set the initial bounds for the control.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.GetControlClassDefaultSize.Result
element.short: TSize value with the dimensions for the new class instance.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.CalcButtonVisible
element.short: Indicates whether the Button for the control should be visible.

descr.p: CalcButtonVisible is a Boolean function used to determine whether the Button for the control should be visible. The return value is True when the control is Visible and the Edit has focus, or the control is not configured to display its button only when focused.
descr.remark: The return value is always True at design-time.
descr.p: CalcButtonVisible is used in the implementation of the CheckButtonVisible method.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.GetDefaultGlyphName
element.short: GetDefaultGlyphName finds the name of the default glyph used for the Button.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.CheckButtonVisible
element.short: Ensures the Button for the control is configured and its visibility is set.

descr.p: CheckButtonVisible is a procedure which ensures that the Button in the control is configured and its visibility is set. If Button has not been assigned (contains Nil), no actions are performed in the method.

Otherwise, the Visible property in Button is set to the value returned by CalcButtonVisible. UpdateSpacing is called to adjust the space between Edit and Button as needed for its visibility and Layout.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.LoadDefaultGlyph
element.short: Loads the default glyph displayed on the Button for the control.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.GlyphChanged
element.short: Performs action needed when the glyph assigned in Button has changed.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.Button
element.short: Button is the TSpeedButton that is attached to the grouped edit control.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.ButtonCaption
element.short: Contains the caption used for the Button on the grouped edit control.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.ButtonCursor
element.short: Cursor shape displayed when the mouse hovers over the Button in the control.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.ButtonHint
element.short: ButtonHint is the hint that pops up when the mouse hovers over the button.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.ButtonOnlyWhenFocused
element.short: ButtonOnlyWhenFocused - if True, the SpeedButton only appears when focus is given to the EditButton control.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.ButtonWidth
element.short: ButtonWidth is the width for the TSpeedButton used in the grouped edit control.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.Edit
element.short: Edit is the TEbEdit control used to perform direct input for the value in the grouped edit control.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.Flat
element.short: Flat - if True, SpeedButton appears flat rather than three-dimensional.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.FocusOnButtonClick
element.short: Indicates if the focus is changed to the Edit control after the Button is clicked.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.Glyph
element.short: Glyph - the small graphic image on the SpeedButton, which ought to indicate its function.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.NumGlyphs
element.short: NumGlyphs - the number of available glyphs.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.Images
element.short: Contains the Images that can be displayed on the Button for the grouped edit control.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.ImageIndex
element.short: Ordinal position in Images for the bitmap displayed on the Button control.

descr.p: Read and write access for the property are redirected to the ImageIndex property in Button.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.ImageWidth
element.short: Specifies the width of the image displayed on the Button control.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.Spacing
element.short: Specifies the amount of space reserved between the Edit and Button controls when Button is visible.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.OnButtonClick
element.short: OnButtonClick - event handler for a mouse click on the SpeedButton.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.Create
element.short: Create - constructor for TCustomEditButton: calls inherited Create then sets some defaults and initializes some variables.

descr.p: Create - constructor for TCustomEditButton: calls inherited Create then sets some defaults and initializes some variables.
Initializes height and width, cursor, glyph, style, checks visibility, event handler for click.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.Create.AOwner
element.short: Owner of the class instance.

element.name: TCustomEditButton.Destroy
element.short: Destructor for the class instance.

element.name: TEditButton
element.short: Implements a grouped edit control with both an Edit and a Button.

descr.p: TEditButton implements a grouped edit control with both an Edit and a Button. TEditButton is derived from the TCustomEditButton class, and sets the visibility for properties declared in the ancestor classes.

element.name: TEditButton.BorderStyle
element.short: Style for the Border drawn around the control.

descr.p: The default value for the property is bsNone in TEditButton.

element.name: TFilterStringOption
element.short: String filter options which can be enabled in controls.

descr.p: TFilterStringOption is an enumerated type with values representing string filter options which can be enabled in controls which support the feature. TFilterStringOption values are stored in the TFilterStringOptions set type used to implement the FilterOptions property in TCustomControlFilterEdit.

element.name: TFilterStringOption.fsoCaseSensitive
element.short: Value comparisons are case sensitive.

element.name: TFilterStringOption.fsoMatchOnlyAtStart
element.short: Value comparisons start at the beginning to the string value.

element.name: TFilterStringOptions
element.short: Set type used to store values from the TFilterStringOption enumeration.

element.name: TFilterItemEvent
element.short: Specifies an event handler used to filter data items in TCustomControlFilterEdit.

descr.p: TFilterItemEvent is a Boolean object function type that specifies an event handler used to filter data items in TCustomControlFilterEdit. The return value is True if an item matches a filter condition implemented in the event handler. Done can be updated to indicate if the item requires additional filtering on the title string in the data item; when it contains True, no additional filtering is needed.
TFilterItemEvent is the type used for the OnFilterItem event handler in TCustomControlFilterEdit.

element.name: TFilterItemEvent.Result
element.short: True if the item matches the filter implemented in the event handler.

element.name: TFilterItemEvent.ItemData
element.short: Pointer to the data for the item examined in the event handler.

element.name: TFilterItemEvent.Done
element.short: Indicates if additional filtering is needed on the title of the item data.

element.name: TFilterItemExEvent
element.short: Specifies an event handler used to filter data items in TCustomControlFilterEdit.

descr.p: TFilterItemExEvent is a Boolean object function type that specifies an event handler used to filter data items in TCustomControlFilterEdit. It is similar to TFilterItemEvent, but provides an additional argument with the caption for the data item.

The return value is True if an item matches a filter condition implemented in the event handler. Done can be updated to indicate if the item requires additional filtering on the title string in the data item; when it contains True, no additional filtering is needed.
TFilterItemEventEx is the type used for the OnFilterItemEx event handler in TCustomControlFilterEdit.

element.name: TFilterItemExEvent.Result
element.short: True if the item matches the filter implemented in the event handler.

element.name: TFilterItemExEvent.ACaption
element.short: Caption or display name for the item examined in the event handler.

element.name: TFilterItemExEvent.ItemData
element.short: Pointer to the data for the item examined in the event handler.

element.name: TFilterItemExEvent.Done
element.short: Indicates if additional filtering is needed for the caption or item data.

element.name: TCheckItemEvent
element.short: Specifies an event handler is to determine if the specified Item is checked.

descr.p: TCheckItemEvent specifies an event handler that can be used only for items that have a checkbox. Returns True when the item is checked. It will be necessary to cast the object instance in Item to the correct data type in the event handler to access properties introduced in a TObject descendant.
TCheckItemEvent is the type used to implement the OnCheckItem event handler in TCustomControlFilterEdit.

element.name: TCheckItemEvent.Result
element.short: True when the item is checked.

element.name: TCheckItemEvent.Item
element.short: Object examined in the method.

element.name: TCustomControlFilterEdit
element.short: Base class for edit controls which filter data in an associated control like TListbox or TTreeview.

descr.p: When the container control is connected to a filter control, the filtering happens automatically as a user enters text. When the filter is empty and does not have focus, it displays the greyed value "(filter)".

element.name: TCustomControlFilterEdit.SetFilter
element.short: Sets the value for the Filter property.

element.name: TCustomControlFilterEdit.SetFilter.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomControlFilterEdit.SetIdleConnected
element.short: Sets the value for the IdleConnected property.

element.name: TCustomControlFilterEdit.SetIdleConnected.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCustomControlFilterEdit.OnIdle
element.short: Event handler signalled to apply a filter when an Application becomes idle.

descr.p: OnIdle is a procedure which implements a TIdleEvent event handler signalled to apply a filter when the Application becomes idle. OnIdle is assigned (using AddOnIdleHandler) or removed (using RemoveOnIdleHandler) in the global Application instance when the value in IdleConnected is changed.

OnIdle uses an internal flag to determine if an update is needed, and when set, calls ApplyFilter to activate the filter and resets the flag value. Use the OnFilterItemEx or OnFilterItem (deprecated) event handlers to perform actions needed to implement the filter.
OnIdle signals the OnAfterFilter event handler (when assigned).

element.name: TCustomControlFilterEdit.OnIdle.Sender
element.short: Object for the event notification.

element.name: TCustomControlFilterEdit.IsTextHintStored
element.descr: Indicates if the value in TextHint is stored in the LCL component streaming mechanism
element.short: The value is True when TextHint contains a value other than the rsFilter resource string. .

element.name: TCustomControlFilterEdit.IsTextHintStored.Result
element.short: True when TextHint is included in the LCL component stream.

element.name: TCustomControlFilterEdit.fNeedUpdate
element.short: Flag which indicates that the filter has been updated and needs to be applied.

element.name: TCustomControlFilterEdit.fIsFirstUpdate
element.short: Flag indicating if the filter has ever been applied.

element.name: TCustomControlFilterEdit.fSelectedPart
element.short: Node to select during the next update.

element.name: TCustomControlFilterEdit.fOnFilterItem
element.short: Stores the event handler in the OnFilterItem property.

element.name: TCustomControlFilterEdit.fOnFilterItemEx
element.short: Stores the event handler in the OnFilterItemEx property.

element.name: TCustomControlFilterEdit.fOnCheckItem
element.short: Stores the event handler in the OnCheckItem property.

element.name: TCustomControlFilterEdit.DestroyWnd
element.short: Ensures that the Canvas for the control is freed before the window handle is destroyed.

element.name: TCustomControlFilterEdit.DoDefaultFilterItem
element.short: Provides a default routine used to examine an item in the filtered edit control.

descr.p: Signals the OnFilterItemEx (preferred) or OnFilterItem (deprecated) event handlers (when assigned) to determine if the item meets the filter condition. Values in ACaption and ItemData are passed as arguments to the event handlers.

The return value is True when the item meets the filter condition(s) implemented in the event handlers. The DoDefaultFilterItem method is called when the return value is False, or the event handlers are not assigned in the class instance.

element.name: TCustomControlFilterEdit.DoDefaultFilterItem.Result
element.short: True when the item meets the filter condition.

element.name: TCustomControlFilterEdit.DoDefaultFilterItem.ACaption
element.short: Caption for the item passed to DoDefaultFilterItem.

element.name: TCustomControlFilterEdit.DoDefaultFilterItem.ItemData
element.short: Pointer to the data for the item examined in the method.

element.name: TCustomControlFilterEdit.DoFilterItem
element.short: Filters items using the handlers for the control.

element.name: TCustomControlFilterEdit.DoFilterItem.Result
element.short: Returns True when the item meets the filter criterion.

element.name: TCustomControlFilterEdit.DoFilterItem.ACaption
element.short: Caption for the item.

element.name: TCustomControlFilterEdit.DoFilterItem.ItemData
element.short: Pointer to the data for the item.

element.name: TCustomControlFilterEdit.EditKeyDown
element.short: Gandles a KeyDown event for the Edit control.

element.name: TCustomControlFilterEdit.EditChange
element.short: Performs actions needed when the Edit is changed.

element.name: TCustomControlFilterEdit.BuddyClick
element.short: Performs actions when the Button for the control is clicked.

descr.p: BuddyClick is an overridden method used to perform actions needed when the Button for the control is clicked. It clears values in the Text and Filter properties, and gives focus to the Edit when FocusOnButtonClick is set to True. It calls the inherited method prior to exit.

element.name: TCustomControlFilterEdit.SortAndFilter
element.short: Sorts the data in the associated control and applies the filter.

descr.p: SortAndFilter is an abstract virtual method in TCustomControlFilterEdit. It must be implemented in a descendent class to provide the specific functionality needed.

element.name: TCustomControlFilterEdit.ApplyFilter
element.short: Filters the data and updates the container.

descr.p: Does its job at once when Immediately is set to True. Otherwise, it connects the OnIdle event handler which applies the filter when the Application is idle.

element.name: TCustomControlFilterEdit.ApplyFilter.Immediately
element.short: Indicates the filter is applied immediately.

element.name: TCustomControlFilterEdit.ApplyFilterCore
element.short: Applies the Filter data to the container component.
element.descr: Method that actually filters data in the container component. ApplyFilterCore is a virtual abstract method, and must be implemented in a derived classes.

element.name: TCustomControlFilterEdit.MoveNext
element.short: Moves to the next value matching the filter for the control.
element.descr: Abstract virtual method that must be implemented in a descendent class.

element.name: TCustomControlFilterEdit.MovePrev
element.short: Moves to the previous value matching the filter for the control.
element.descr: Abstract virtual method that must be implemented in a descendent class.

element.name: TCustomControlFilterEdit.MovePageUp
element.short: Moves one page of previous values matching the filter.
element.descr: Abstract virtual method that must be implemented in a descendent class.

element.name: TCustomControlFilterEdit.MovePageDown
element.short: Moves one page of subsequent values matching the filter.
element.descr: Abstract virtual method that must be implemented in a descendent class.

element.name: TCustomControlFilterEdit.MoveHome
element.short: Moves to the first value matching the filter.
element.descr: Abstract virtual method that must be implemented in a descendent class.

element.name: TCustomControlFilterEdit.MoveEnd
element.short: Moves to the last value matching the filter.
element.descr: Abstract virtual method that must be implemented in a descendent class.

element.name: TCustomControlFilterEdit.ReturnKeyHandled
element.short: Indicates whether an assigned OnKeyPress event handler handles the Return or Enter key in the KeyDown method for the Edit.
element.descr: Abstract virtual method that must be implemented in a descendent class.

element.name: TCustomControlFilterEdit.ReturnKeyHandled.Result
element.short: True if OnKeyPress is assigned and handles the VK_RETURN key code.

element.name: TCustomControlFilterEdit.WSRegisterClass
element.short: Registers the class reference used to create new instances of the class.

element.name: TCustomControlFilterEdit.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Create is the constructor for the class instance, and calls the inherited constructor. Create sets the default values for properties used to configure the Edit and Button in the class instance as well as its internal flags, including:

element.name: TCustomControlFilterEdit.Create.AOwner
element.short: Owner for the class instance.

element.name: TCustomControlFilterEdit.Destroy
element.short: Destructor for the class instance.

element.name: TCustomControlFilterEdit.InvalidateFilter
element.short: Should be called when data was changed and it must be filtered again.
element.descr: Connects to OnIdle handler which filters the data later.

element.name: TCustomControlFilterEdit.ResetFilter
element.short: Removes the filter text and shows all items in the container.

element.name: TCustomControlFilterEdit.ForceFilter
element.short: Applies a new filter immediately without waiting for idle. Returns the previous filter.

element.name: TCustomControlFilterEdit.StoreSelection
element.short: Stores the current selection for the associated control in the class instance.

descr.p: StoreSelection is an abstract virtual method, and must be implemented in a derived class to use the correct class type for items in the associated control.
Used in the implementation of the ApplyFilter method.

element.name: TCustomControlFilterEdit.RestoreSelection
element.short: Restores the selection in the associated control after the filter is applied.

descr.p: Abstract virtual method that must be implemented in a descendent class.

element.name: TCustomControlFilterEdit.Filter
element.short: The textual representation for the filter.
element.descr: Typically a user types it in the edit control but it can also be set in code. Filtering is done during idle time after the value of Filter text has changed.

element.name: TCustomControlFilterEdit.FilterLowercase
element.short: Lowercase variant of the Filter property.

descr.p: FilterLowercase is a read-only String property which contains a variant of Filter converted to lowercase characters. It is used in the implementation of the DoDefaultFilterItem method when case sensitivity is not enabled in the FilterOptions property ( fsoCaseSensitive is not included). The property can be used in a similar manner in routines assigned to the OnFilterItem and OnFilterItemEx event handlers.
The value for FilterLowercase is derived and assigned when the value in the Filter property is changed.

element.name: TCustomControlFilterEdit.IdleConnected
element.short: Indicates if OnIdle has been connected to the Application singleton.

descr.p: IdleConnected is a Boolean property which indicates if the OnIdle event handler in the class instance has been connected to the Application singleton. When set to True, the Filter in the control will be applied when the application is in an idle state.

Changing the value in the property causes the Application singleton to be updated by calling either the AddOnIdleHandler or the RemoveOnIdleHandler method. The address for the OnIdle method in the class is passed as an argument.
IdleConnected is set to True in the InvalidateFilter method.
IdleConnected is set to False in the OnIdle method after the Filter has been applied for the control.
The default value for the property is False.

element.name: TCustomControlFilterEdit.SortData
element.short: Items can be sorted while they are filtered.

element.name: TCustomControlFilterEdit.SelectedPart
element.short: For retaining selection in the filtered control. The actual type depends on the associated control.

element.name: TCustomControlFilterEdit.FilterOptions
element.short: Contains options which control string comparisons for filters in the control.

descr.p: FilterOptions is a TFilterStringOptions property which contains zero (0) or more TFilterStringOption enumeration values(s). Values in FilterOptions determine how string comparisons are performed in the DoDefaultFilterItem method. See for more information about the enumeration values and their meanings.
The default value for the property is an empty set ([]).

element.name: TCustomControlFilterEdit.OnAfterFilter
element.short: Called after all items are filtered.

element.name: TCustomControlFilterEdit.OnFilterItem
element.short: An event handler to give extra conditions for filtering, in addition to the default behavior. Returns True if the passes the filter.
element.descr: This feature has, for example, enabled filtering the Options windows in Lazarus IDE based on captions for all controls on the options pages. Deprecated. Use OnFilterItemEx with a caption parameter instead.

element.name: TCustomControlFilterEdit.OnFilterItemEx
element.short: Event handler signalled to filter data in the control using its caption or item data.

element.name: TCustomControlFilterEdit.OnCheckItem
element.short: Has effect when items in the filtered container can be checked. Typically a CheckListbox.

element.name: TAcceptFileNameEvent
element.short: TAcceptFileNameEvent - generic event handling method to accept a filename from a dialog.

element.name: TAcceptFileNameEvent.Sender
element.short: Object for the event notification.

element.name: TAcceptFileNameEvent.Value
element.short: File name examined in the event handler.

element.name: TDialogKind
element.short: Enumerated type representing dialog styles used in TFileNameEdit.

descr.p: TDialogKind is an enumerated type representing the dialog styles available for use in TFileNameEdit. Values in the enumeration influence the common dialog type created for a control which displays a dialog when its button is clicked.
TDialogKind is the type used to implement the DialogKind property in TFileNameEdit.

element.name: TDialogKind.dkOpen
element.short: An Open dialog.

element.name: TDialogKind.dkSave
element.short: A Save dialog.

element.name: TDialogKind.dkPictureOpen
element.short: An Open dialog for image types.

element.name: TDialogKind.dkPictureSave
element.short: A Save dialog for image types.

element.name: TFileNameEdit
element.short: TFileNameEdit - an EditBox to hold a filename, with an attached SpeedButton that summons a File Open dialog.

descr.p: TFileNameEdit is a TCustomEditButton descendant which implements a grouped edit control used to select and edit a file name on the local file system. The control provides the Edit and Button properties from the ancestor class, and executes a dialog when the Button is clicked. New properties are introduced which allow configuring the control to a specific file path, filters to select files of particular type or file extension, and to hide or show directories in its dialog.

element.name: TFileNameEdit.SetFileName
element.short: Sets the value for the FileName property.

element.name: TFileNameEdit.SetFileName.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TFileNameEdit.GetDefaultGlyphName
element.short: Gets the default glyph name used for the Button on the control.

descr.p: The return value contains the resource ID in the ResBtnFileOpen constant. The value is used in the LoadDefaultGlyph method defined in TCustomEditButton.

element.name: TFileNameEdit.CreateDialog
element.short: Creates the dialog for the control.

descr.p: CreateDialog is a TCommonDialog function which creates and returns the dialog for the grouped edit control.

AKind contains the TDialogKind value that identifies the dialog type required for the control, and normally has the value from the DialogKind property. AKind determines the class type instantiated and used as the return value. For example:

dl.dd: TOpenDialog is the type in return value
TOpenPictureDialog is the type in return value
TSaveDialog is the type in return value

descr.p: Properties relevant to the dialog kind are copied into the dialog, and mat include:
CreateDialog is used in the implementation of the RunDialog method.

element.name: TFileNameEdit.CreateDialog.Result
element.short: Dialog class instance created in the method.

element.name: TFileNameEdit.CreateDialog.AKind
element.short: Identifies the dialog kind or type created in the method.

element.name: TFileNameEdit.SaveDialogResult
element.short: SaveDialogResult - stores the result of the dialog.

descr.p: SaveDialogResult is a procedure used to capture the results from the dialog when it has finished execution. The values are stored in the corresponding properties in the class instance, and depending on the DialogKind, may include:
SaveDialogResult is used in the implementation of the RunDialog method.

element.name: TFileNameEdit.SaveDialogResult.AKind
element.short: Dialog type in the D argument.

element.name: TFileNameEdit.SaveDialogResult.D
element.short: Dialog examined in the method.

element.name: TFileNameEdit.ButtonClick
element.short: Performs actions needed when the Button for the control is clicked.

descr.p: ButtonClick is an overridden method used to perform actions needed when the Button for the control is clicked. For TFileNameEdit, the RunDialog method is called to execute the dialog for the control and to capture it results. When FocusOnButtonClick is set, the FocusAndMaybeSelectAll method is called to give focus to the Edit control in the class.

element.name: TFileNameEdit.EditChange
element.short: Performs actions needed when the value for the control has been changed.

element.name: TFileNameEdit.DoFolderChange
element.short: Signals the OnFolderChange event handler (when assigned).

element.name: TFileNameEdit.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Create is the overridden constructor for the class instance, and calls the inherited constructor. Create allocates resource needed for the DialogFiles property, and sets the default values for the DialogKind and DialogOptions properties.

element.name: TFileNameEdit.Create.AOwner
element.short: Owner of the class instance.

element.name: TFileNameEdit.Destroy
element.short: Destructor for the class instance.

element.name: TFileNameEdit.RunDialog
element.short: RunDialog executes the dialog for the control.

element.name: TFileNameEdit.DialogFiles
element.short: DialogFiles is the list of files for the dialog.

descr.p: DialogFiles is a read-only TStrings property used to store one or more file names found when the dialog for the control is executed. DialogFiles is updated in the SaveDialogResult method. For open dialogs, DialogFiles is set to the files returned by the dialog. For save dialogs, the content in DialogFiles is cleared.

element.name: TFileNameEdit.FileName
element.short: FileName - the name of the selected file: either the initial value placed in the Text Box, or the value selected from the dialog.

element.name: TFileNameEdit.InitialDir
element.short: InitialDir is the directory from which the search starts.

element.name: TFileNameEdit.OnAcceptFileName
element.short: OnAcceptFileName is an event handler for accepting a filename.

element.name: TFileNameEdit.OnFolderChange
element.short: Event handler signalled when the path to FileName has changed.

element.name: TFileNameEdit.DialogKind
element.short: Determines the dialog type executed when the Button in the control is clicked.

descr.p: DialogKind is a TDialogKind property that indicates the type of dialog executed when the Button for the control is clicked. The default value for the property is dkOpen, as assigned in the constructor. Use one of the other TDialogKind enumeration values to perform its corresponding action.

element.name: TFileNameEdit.DialogTitle
element.short: DialogTitle - the title to appear on the dialog.

descr.p: DialogTitle is a String property that contains the title displayed on the dialog executed by clicking on Button. The value in DialogTitle is assigned to the TCommonDialog descendant created in the CreateDialog method.

element.name: TFileNameEdit.DialogOptions
element.short: DialogOptions - set of options enabled for the file open dialog.

descr.p: DialogOptions is a TOpenOptions property which contains the options enabled for a File Open dialog. The default value for the property is defined in the DefaultOpenDialogOptions constant.
Values in DialogOptions control the functionality and visual appearance of the dialog displayed for the control. See for more information about the enumeration values used in DialogOptions.

element.name: TFileNameEdit.Filter
element.short: Filter - the filtering string to help search for the required file.

element.name: TFileNameEdit.FilterIndex
element.short: FilterIndex - index value for the filtering string.

element.name: TFileNameEdit.DefaultExt
element.short: Default file extension used in the dialog for the component.

element.name: TFileNameEdit.HideDirectories
element.short: Hide directory name from edit.

descr.p: If HideDirectories is set to true, the file name editor displays only a file name, without path.
descr.remark: This may be useful if application allows user to select files from a fixed directory with a long path.

element.name: TFileNameEdit.ButtonCaption
element.short: Text displayed on the button for the control.

element.name: TFileNameEdit.ButtonCursor
element.short: Cursor shape displayed when hovering the mouse over the button for the control.

element.name: TFileNameEdit.ButtonHint
element.short: Text displayed in the balloon hint for the button in the control.

element.name: TFileNameEdit.ButtonOnlyWhenFocused
element.short: Controls visibility of the Button when the control loses focus.

element.name: TFileNameEdit.ButtonWidth
element.short: Width of the Button displayed in the control.

element.name: TDirectoryEdit
element.short: TDirectoryEdit - an EditBox to hold a directory name, with an attached SpeedButton that summons a Directory Open dialog.

element.name: TDirectoryEdit.GetDirectory
element.short: Gets the value for the Directory property.

element.name: TDirectoryEdit.GetDirectory.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TDirectoryEdit.SetDirectory
element.short: Sets the value for the Directory property.

element.name: TDirectoryEdit.SetDirectory.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TDirectoryEdit.CreateDialog
element.short: Creates and configures the dialog for the control.

descr.p: CreateDialog is a TCommonDialog function which creates and configures the Directory Open dialog executed when the Button is clicked for the control. In TDirectoryEdit, the class type instantiated and used as the return value is actually TSelectDirectoryDialog.

CreateDialog ensures that values for the InitialDir and FileName properties in the dialog are set using the properties in the class instance. Directory and Filename are used in the the dialog when the directory exists on the local file system. Otherwise, the initial directory is set to the value in RootDir and the file name is set to the value in Directory.
CreateDialog set the options in the dialog to the values specified in DialogOptions, and the value in DialogTitle is used as the title for the dialog.
CreateDialog is used in the implementation of the RunDialog method.

element.name: TDirectoryEdit.CreateDialog.Result
element.short: Dialog created and configured in the method.

element.name: TDirectoryEdit.GetDialogResult
element.short: Gets the result from the specified dialog.

descr.p: GetDialogResult is a String function used to get the result from the Select Directory dialog. The return value contains the value from the FileName property in the TSelectDirectoryDialog instance in D. The return value, when accepted in OnAcceptDirectory, is stored in the Directory property.
GetDialogResult is used in the implementation of the RunDialog method.

element.name: TDirectoryEdit.GetDialogResult.Result
element.short: Directory name from the dialog.

element.name: TDirectoryEdit.GetDialogResult.D
element.short: Dialog examined in the method.

element.name: TDirectoryEdit.ButtonClick
element.short: Implements the button handler for the Button in the control.

descr.p: ButtonClick is an overridden method used to implement the button click handler for the Button in the control. ButtonClick calls the inherited method, and calls RunDialog to display the dialog and capture the directory name. When the dialog has completed, and FocusOnButtonClick is set to True, the FocusAndMaybeSelectAll method is called to give focus to the Edit control and select text as needed.
ButtonClick is called from the BuddyClick method in the ancestor class.

element.name: TDirectoryEdit.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Create is the overridden constructor for the class instance, and calls the inherited constructor. Create sets the values in the DialogOptions property to the defaults in DefaultOpenDialogOptions.

element.name: TDirectoryEdit.Create.AOwner
element.short: Owner of the class instance.

element.name: TDirectoryEdit.RunDialog
element.short: Executes the dialog for the control and stores the return value.

descr.p: RunDialog is a procedure used to execute the dialog for the control, and to store the selected directory name in the control. RunDialog calls CreateDialog to create and configure the dialog executed in the method. When the dialog has completed successfully, GetDialogResult is called to capture the selected directory name.

When assigned, the OnAcceptDirectory event handler is signalled to accept or reject the selected directory name. When rejected, the return value is ignored. When accepted, the value returned from the dialog is stored in the Directory property.
RunDialog is used in the implementation of the ButtonClick method.

element.name: TDirectoryEdit.Directory
element.short: The Directory selected by the dialog.

descr.p: Directory is a String property which contains the active directory, and the value displayed in the Edit for the control.

Directory and RootDir determine the values used in the Select Directory dialog executed when the Button is clicked for the control. When Directory is a valid file path on the local file system, it is used as the initial directory displayed in the dialog. Otherwise, the value in RootDir is used as the initial directory and Directory is used as the file name in the dialog.
The value in Directory is updated in the RunDialog method when the dialog for the control has been executed successfully.

element.name: TDirectoryEdit.RootDir
element.short: The root directory for file system navigation in the control.

descr.p: RootDir is a String property which identifies the root directory for file system navigation in the Select Directory dialog for the control. Its value, along with Directory, is used in the CreateDialog method to configure the dialog.

RootDir is relevant when Directory does not represent a valid path on the local file system. It is used as the initial directory in the Select Directory dialog. When Directory is a valid file path, RootDir is ignored.

element.name: TDirectoryEdit.OnAcceptDirectory
element.short: OnAcceptDirectory - event handler for accepting the name of a directory.

element.name: TDirectoryEdit.DialogTitle
element.short: DialogTitle - the title that appears on the Select Directory dialog.

element.name: TDirectoryEdit.DialogOptions
element.short: Contains the options enabled for the Open dialog displayed by the control.

descr.p: The default value for the property is defined in the DefaultOpenDialogOptions set.

element.name: TDirectoryEdit.ShowHidden
element.short: ShowHidden - if True, display names of hidden directories.

descr.p: ShowHidden - if True, display names of hidden directories. In Windows etc, show directories under 'Windows' and branches; in Linux etc show directories with preceding dot e.g. '.Lazarus'.

element.name: TDirectoryEdit.ButtonCaption
element.short: Text displayed on the button for the control.

element.name: TDirectoryEdit.ButtonCursor
element.short: Cursor shape displayed when the mouse hovers over the button for the control.

element.name: TDirectoryEdit.ButtonHint
element.short: Hint displayed when the mouse hovers over the button for the control.

element.name: TAcceptDateEvent
element.short: TAcceptDateEvent - generic event handling method for accepting a date from a dialog.

descr.p: TAcceptDateEvent is an object procedure which specifies an event handler used to examine and verify a TDateTime value.
Senderis the object generating the event notification.
ADate is the TDateTime value examined in the event handler.

AcceptDate is a variable Boolean argument which indicates if the TDateTime value meets the criteria implemented in the event handler. Set AcceptDate to False to indicate that the TDateTime value should be rejected.
TAcceptDateEvent is the type used to implement the OnAcceptDate property in TDateEdit.

element.name: TAcceptDateEvent.Sender
element.short: Object generating the event notification.

element.name: TAcceptDateEvent.ADate
element.short: TDateTime value examined in the method.

element.name: TAcceptDateEvent.AcceptDate
element.short: Indicates if the Date/Time can be accepted when True.

element.name: TCustomDateEvent
element.short: Specifies an event handler used to examine or alter a String with a date value.

descr.p: TCustomDateEvent is an object procedure which specifies an event handler used to examine or alter a String with a date value in an arbitrary format.
Sender is the object generating the event notification.
ADate is a variable String argument which can be examined or altered in the event handler.
TCustomDateEvent is the type used to implement the OnCustomDate event handler in TDateEdit.

element.name: TCustomDateEvent.Sender
element.short: Object generating the event notification.

element.name: TCustomDateEvent.ADate
element.short: Variable String argument which can be examined or altered in the event handler.

element.name: TDateOrder
element.short: Controls the display order for Month, Day, and Year portions of a date value.

descr.p: TDateOrder is an enumerated type with values that indicate the display order for the Month, Day, and Year portions of a date value.
TDateOrder is the type used to implement the DateOrder property in TDateEdit, and passed as an argument to the ParseDate routine in the implementation for the unit.

element.name: TDateOrder.doNone
element.short: No order is specified for the Year, Month, and Day values.

element.name: TDateOrder.doMDY
element.short: Displayed in Month, Day, Year order.

element.name: TDateOrder.doDMY
element.short: Displayed in Day, Month, Year order.

element.name: TDateOrder.doYMD
element.short: Displayed in Year, Month, Day order.

element.name: TDateEdit
element.short: Implements a control with an edit box for a date value, with an attached speed button to display a date selection (calendar) dialog.

descr.p: TDateEdit is a TCustomEditButton descendant which implements a grouped edit control for entering a date value. The control uses an Edit and a Button, as defined in the ancestor class, and implements a Calendar dialog to select a date value when the Button is clicked. The value is stored in the Date property as a TDateTime value.
TDateEdit provides additional properties which are used to configure the Edit and Button controls and the dialog executed when Button is clicked.

element.name: TDateEdit.SetFreeDateFormat
element.short: Sets the value for the DateFormat property.

element.name: TDateEdit.SetFreeDateFormat.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TDateEdit.TextToDate
element.short: Converts the specified text to a TDateTime value with an optional default value.

element.name: TDateEdit.TextToDate.Result
element.short: TDateTime value for the specified text.

element.name: TDateEdit.TextToDate.AText
element.short: Text examined in the method.

element.name: TDateEdit.TextToDate.ADefault
element.short: Default TDateTime value used when the text cannot be converted.

element.name: TDateEdit.GetDate
element.short: Gets the value for the Date property.

element.name: TDateEdit.GetDate.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TDateEdit.SetDate
element.short: Sets the value for the Date property.

element.name: TDateEdit.SetDate.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TDateEdit.CalendarPopupReturnDate
element.short: Implements the OnReturnDate event handler used in the dialog in the control.

descr.p: CalendarPopupReturnDate is a procedure which implements the TReturnDateEvent event handler used to validate and store the date returned from the dialog for the control. It is passed as an argument when calling the ShowCalendarPopup routine in the ButtonClick method.
CalendarPopupReturnDate signals the OnAcceptDate event handler (when assigned) to accept or reject the value in ADate. The value in ADate is stored in the Date property when accepted in OnAcceptDate.
CalendarPopupReturnDate handles any exception which occurs in the method, or in the OnAcceptDate event handler, and displays a Message Dialog with the message from the exception.

element.name: TDateEdit.CalendarPopupReturnDate.Sender
element.short: Object generating the event notification.

element.name: TDateEdit.CalendarPopupReturnDate.ADate
element.short: Date/Time value examined and stored in the method.

element.name: TDateEdit.CalendarPopupShowHide
element.short: Implements the event handler used to toggle the visibility of the dialog form for the control.

descr.p: CalendarPopupShowHide is a procedure which implements the event handler used to toggle the visibility of the dialog form for the control. CalendarPopupShowHide is passed as an argument when calling the ShowCalendarPopup routine in the ButtonClick method.
CalendarPopupShowHide checks the visibility of the form in Sender (a TCalendarPopupForm in this usage), and assigns the value to the DroppedDown property in the class instance.

element.name: TDateEdit.CalendarPopupShowHide.Sender
element.short: Object generating the event notification; the TCalendarPopupForm instance in this case.

element.name: TDateEdit.SetDateOrder
element.short: Sets the value for the DateOrder property.

element.name: TDateEdit.SetDateOrder.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TDateEdit.DateToText
element.short: Converts the specified TDateTime value to a string.

descr.p: DateToText is a String function used to convert the TDateTime value in the Value parameter to its textual representation. The return value is an empty String ('') when Value is equal to the NullDate constant.

DateToText uses DefaultFormatSettings to generate the return value when DateOrder is doNone using the short date format in the DateFormat property. When DateOrder contains another value from the enumeration, the edit mask for the fixed date format is used to generate the return value.
DateToText is used in the implementation of the SetDate, RealSetText, and EditEditingDone methods.

element.name: TDateEdit.DateToText.Result
element.short: Text for the converted date/time value.

element.name: TDateEdit.DateToText.Value
element.short: TDateTime vale converted in the method.

element.name: TDateEdit.WSRegisterClass
element.short: Registers the class reference used to create new instances of the class.

element.name: TDateEdit.GetDefaultGlyphName
element.short: Gets the default glyph name displayed on the Button for the control.

descr.p: GetDefaultGlyphName is overridden in TDateEdit to return the resource name specified in the ResBtnCalendar constant.

element.name: TDateEdit.GetDefaultGlyphName.Result
element.short: Resource name for the default glyph.

element.name: TDateEdit.ButtonClick
element.short: Implements the handler executed when the Button for the control is clicked.

element.name: TDateEdit.EditDblClick
element.short: Performs actions needed when the Edit in the control is double clicked.

descr.p: EditDblClick is an overridden procedure in TDateEdit. It calls the inherited method, and checks to ensure that the control is not marked as ReadOnly before calling the ButtonClick method.

element.name: TDateEdit.EditEditingDone
element.short: Implement the OnEditingDone event handler for the Edit in the control.

element.name: TDateEdit.SetDirectInput
element.short: Sets the value in the DirectInput property.

descr.p: SetDirectory is overridden in TDateEdit to synchronize the values in the Text and Date properties when DirectInput is changed.

element.name: TDateEdit.SetDirectInput.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TDateEdit.RealSetText
element.short: Sets the value for the control.

descr.p: RealSetText is overridden in TDateEdit to ensure that DefaultToday is used to set the Date when Text is an empty string. Calls the inherited RealSetText method.

element.name: TDateEdit.RealSetText.AValue
element.short: New value for the control.

element.name: TDateEdit.SetDateMask
element.short: Applies a mask to the Edit control suitable for the DateOrder in the control.

element.name: TDateEdit.Loaded
element.short: Performs actions needed when the component has finished loading in the LCL streaming mechanism.

element.name: TDateEdit.Create
element.short: Create - constructor for TDateEdit: calls inherited Create and sets defaults.

descr.p: Create - constructor for TDateEdit: calls inherited Create and sets defaults.
Initializes the dialog title, caption, display settings, and the default date.

element.name: TDateEdit.Create.AOwner
element.short: Owner of the class instance.

element.name: TDateEdit.GetDateFormat
element.short: GetDateFormat - returns the format for the date.

element.name: TDateEdit.Date
element.short: Contains the TDateTime value for the control.

element.name: TDateEdit.DroppedDown
element.short: Indicates the dialog for control is visible when True.

element.name: TDateEdit.CalendarDisplaySettings
element.short: CalendarDisplaySettings - governs how the calendar dialog is displayed.

element.name: TDateEdit.OnAcceptDate
element.short: OnAcceptDate - event handler for accepting the date selected in the calendar dialog.

element.name: TDateEdit.OnCustomDate
element.short: OnCustomDate - event handler for inserting a custom date.

element.name: TDateEdit.ReadOnly
element.short: Indicates if the value for the control can be changed.

element.name: TDateEdit.DefaultToday
element.short: DefaultToday - if True, the current date is offered as the default date (value is False by default).
element.descr: Default value for the property is False.

element.name: TDateEdit.DateOrder
element.short: Controls the display order for Year, Month, and Day parts of the date value.

element.name: TDateEdit.DateFormat
element.short: Specifies the editing format used for the date value in the control.

descr.p: DateFormat is a String property which contains the format used when converting the Date value to and from text. DateFormat is relevant when DateOrder contains the value doNone; when another TDateOrder value is used, the fixed format needed for the date order is automatically used.
DateFormat is used in the implementation of the TextToDate and DateToText methods.

element.name: TAcceptTimeEvent
element.short: Specifies an event handler used to validate and accept/reject a time value.

descr.p: TAcceptTimeEvent specifies an event handler used to validate and accept/reject a time value in TTimeEdit. TAcceptTimeEvent is the type used to implement the OnAcceptTime property in TTimeEdit.

element.name: TAcceptTimeEvent.Sender
element.short: Object generating the event notification.

element.name: TAcceptTimeEvent.ATime
element.short: Time value examined in the method.

element.name: TAcceptTimeEvent.AcceptTime
element.short: Indicates the time value is accepted when True.

element.name: TCustomTimeEvent
element.short: Specifies an event handler used to generate an arbitrary time value.

descr.p: TCustomTimeEvent specifies an event handler used to generate an arbitrary TDateTime value. TCustomTimeEvent is the type used to implement the OnCustomTime property in TTimeEdit.

element.name: TCustomTimeEvent.Sender
element.short: Object generating the event notification.

element.name: TCustomTimeEvent.ATime
element.short: TDateTime value generated in the event handler.

element.name: TTimeEdit
element.short: Implements a control used to edit time values.

descr.p: TTimeEdit is a TCustomEditButton descendant which implements a control used to edit a time value. TTimeEdit provides the Edit and Button properties defined in the ancestor class, and a dialog that is executed to select a time value when the Button is clicked.
The time value in the control is represented using the TDateTime type; only the time portion of the value is significant.

element.name: TTimeEdit.GetTime
element.short: Gets the value for the Time property.

element.name: TTimeEdit.GetTime.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TTimeEdit.SetTime
element.short: Sets the value for the Time property.

element.name: TTimeEdit.SetTime.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TTimeEdit.SetEmptyTime
element.short: Sets the value in the Time property to the empty time value.

descr.p: SetEmptyTime is a procedure used to set the value in the Time property to the empty time value. The value in NullDate is assigned as the value for the Time property. In addition, the EmptyStr constant is assigned as the value for the Text property. An internal flag is set to indicate that the time value is empty.
SetEmptyTime is used in the implementation of the ParseInput method, and in the constructor for the class instance.

element.name: TTimeEdit.GetLayout
element.short: Gets the value for the SimpleLayout property.

element.name: TTimeEdit.GetLayout.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TTimeEdit.SetLayout
element.short: Sets the value for the SimpleLayout property.

element.name: TTimeEdit.SetLayout.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TTimeEdit.TimePopupReturnTime
element.short: Implements the event handler used to display the popup dialog for the control, and to capture the returned time value.

element.name: TTimeEdit.TimePopupReturnTime.Sender
element.short: Object generating the event notification.

element.name: TTimeEdit.TimePopupReturnTime.ATime
element.short: Time value returned from the popup dialog.

element.name: TTimeEdit.TimePopupShowHide
element.short: Implements an event handler used to toggle the visibility of the popup dialog for the control.

element.name: TTimeEdit.TimePopupShowHide.Sender
element.short: Object generating the event notification.

element.name: TTimeEdit.OpenTimePopup
element.short: Configures and displays the popup dialog for the control.
element.descr: Used in the implementation of the ButtonClick and EditDblClick methods.

element.name: TTimeEdit.ParseInput
element.short: Parses text in the Edit control and stores the value in the Time property.
element.descr: Used in the implementation of the OpenTimePopup and EditEditingDone methods.

element.name: TTimeEdit.GetDefaultGlyphName
element.short: Gets the resource name for the default glyph displayed on the Button for the control.

element.name: TTimeEdit.GetDefaultGlyphName.Result
element.short: Resource name for the glyph.

element.name: TTimeEdit.ButtonClick
element.short: Performs actions needed when the Button for the control is clicked.

element.name: TTimeEdit.EditDblClick
element.short: Implements the OnDblClick event handler for the Edit in the control.

element.name: TTimeEdit.EditEditingDone
element.short: Implements the OnEditingDone event handler for the Edit in the control.

element.name: TTimeEdit.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

element.name: TTimeEdit.Create.AOwner
element.short: Owner of the class instance.

element.name: TTimeEdit.Time
element.short: Represents the time value in the control.

element.name: TTimeEdit.DroppedDown
element.short: Indicates if the popup dialog for the control is visible.
element.descr: DroppedDown is read-only Boolean property which indicates if the popup dialog for the control is visible.

element.name: TTimeEdit.DefaultNow
element.short: Indicates the current time is used for an empty time value.

descr.p: DefaultNow is a Boolean property which indicates if the time value defaults to the current system time when a empty time value assigned in the control. The default value for the property is False.
DefaultNow is used in the implementation of the GetTime method which gets the value for the Time property.

element.name: TTimeEdit.OnAcceptTime
element.short: Event handler signalled to validate and accept/reject the time value for the control.

element.name: TTimeEdit.OnCustomTime
element.short: Event handler signalled to get an arbitrary time value for the control.

element.name: TTimeEdit.SimpleLayout
element.short: Indicates if the dialog uses a layout with 30 minute intervals between values.

descr.p: SimpleLayout is a Boolean property which indicates if the popup dialog for the control uses the 2 (rows) by 6 (columns) layout with 30 minute intervals between time values. The default value for the property is True. When set to False, a more detailed layout with 12 rows by 5 columns using 5 minute time intervals is used.

element.name: TAcceptValueEvent
element.short: TAcceptValueEvent - generic event handling method for accepting a value from a (calculator) dialog.

element.name: TCalcEdit
element.short: Implements an numeric edit control with a button to display a calculator dialog.

descr.p: TCalcEdit is a TCustomEditButton descendant which implements a numeric edit control with a button to display a calculator dialog. It contains properties to configure the button and the calculator dialog. Other properties are provided to access the numeric value as an Integer or a floating point (Double) data type. Use the RunDIalog method to display the calculator dialog and get its return value.

element.name: TCalcEdit.GetAsFloat
element.short: Gets the value for the AsFloat property.

element.name: TCalcEdit.GetAsFloat.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TCalcEdit.GetAsInteger
element.short: Gets the value for the AsInteger property.

element.name: TCalcEdit.GetAsInteger.Result
element.short: Value for the property.

element.name: TCalcEdit.SetAsFloat
element.short: Sets the value for the AsFloat property.

element.name: TCalcEdit.SetAsFloat.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCalcEdit.SetAsInteger
element.short: Sets the value for the AsInteger property.

element.name: TCalcEdit.SetAsInteger.AValue
element.short: New value for the property.

element.name: TCalcEdit.FCalcDialog
element.short: FCalcDialog - local variable holding the Calculator Dialog for use with this class.

element.name: TCalcEdit.ButtonClick
element.short: Performs actions needed when the button for the control is clicked.

descr.p: ButtonClick is an overridden method used to perform actions needed when the Button for the control is clicked. For TCalcEdit, the RunDialog method is called to execute the dialog for the control and to capture it results. When FocusOnButtonClick is set, the FocusAndMaybeSelectAll method is called to give focus to the Edit control in the class.

element.name: TCalcEdit.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance.

descr.p: Create is the overridden constructor for the class instance. Create calls the inherited constructor, and sets the default values for the following properties:

dl.dd: Uses the value in the rsCalculator constant

element.name: TCalcEdit.Create.AOwner
element.short: Owner of the class instance.

element.name: TCalcEdit.RunDialog
element.short: RunDialog - perform the function of the dialog.

descr.p: RunDialog is a procedure used display the form which captures the value for the control. For TCalcEdit, a TCalculatorForm instance is used instead of a TCommonDialog descendant as used in other grouped edit controls.

Property values in the class are assigned to the form, such as: DialogTitle, DialogTop, DialogLeft, DialogPosition, and AsFloat. The form is displayed modally, and its value is passed to the OnAcceptValue event handler (when assigned). The accepted value is stored in the AsFloat property.

element.name: TCalcEdit.CalculatorLayout
element.short: CalculatorLayout - normal or simple.

element.name: TCalcEdit.AsFloat
element.short: AsFloat - holds the result of the calculation as a floating-point (double precision) number.

element.name: TCalcEdit.AsInteger
element.short: AsInteger - holds the result of the calculation as an Integer.

element.name: TCalcEdit.OnAcceptValue
element.short: OnAcceptValue - event handler for accepting the result of the calculation.

element.name: TCalcEdit.DialogTitle
element.short: DialogTitle - the caption to be used for the dialog.

element.name: TCalcEdit.DialogPosition
element.short: Position where the calculator dialog is displayed.

descr.p: DialogPosition is a TPosition property with the position where the calculator dialog is displayed when the button for the control is clicked. The default value for the property is poScreenCenter.
Values in DialogPosition, DialogTop, and DialogLeft are assigned to the form for the dialog in the RunDialog method.

element.name: TCalcEdit.DialogTop
element.short: Vertical coordinate for the dialog displayed for the control.

element.name: TCalcEdit.DialogLeft
element.short: Horizontal coordinate for the dialog displayed for the control.

element.name: ResBtnListFilter
element.short: Resource name for the default glyph used on the Button in TCustomControlFilterEdit.

element.name: ResBtnFileOpen
element.short: Resource name for the default glyph used on the Button in TFileNameEdit.

element.name: ResBtnSelDir
element.short: Resource name for the default glyph used on the Button in TDirectoryEdit.

element.name: ResBtnCalendar
element.short: Resource name for the default glyph used on the Button in TDateEdit.

element.name: ResBtnCalculator
element.short: Resource name for the default glyph used on the Button in TCalcEdit.

element.name: ResBtnTime
element.short: Resource name for the default glyph used on the Button in TTimeEdit.

element.name: Register
element.short: Registers components in the unit for use in the Lazarus IDE.

descr.p: Register is the procedure used to add components to the component palette in the Lazarus IDE. Register adds the following components to the Misc tab on the component palette:
